TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000McWJz:ref

Hi Botond,

Yes it looks like all Administrators are getting them.
I didn’t see it before as most of the Admin accounts don’t have a mailbox itself.
Whats a bit weird is that the Daily report is send multiple times day ?

If I would disable this in the global settings would I still be able to setup alerts for the Transfer Limit ?

Best regards
Benjamin

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Friday, 7 March 2025 16:59
To: KASTO IT-Abteilung <IT@kasto.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437895 - - Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

Hi Benjamin,

It should be sent out to all EPP administrators.
Does the alert get sent to all of them?

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: KASTO IT-Abteilung [it@kasto.com]
Sent: 3/7/2025 5:21 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437895 - - Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000McWJz:ref


Ok but where do you setup who this report is send to ?

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Friday, 7 March 2025 16:11
To: KASTO IT-Abteilung <IT@kasto.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437895 - - Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

Hi Benjamin,

That feature has its own alert which is not configured from the alert menu, that is why it has the report option within the setting itself.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000McWJz:ref


Hi Botond,

I am sure that in this case the reports will stop coming but eventually we will use this feature in the near future and I think we should find out why they are send without a configured alert.

Best regards
Benjamin

Sent: Friday, 7 March 2025 15:45
To: KASTO IT-Abteilung <IT@kasto.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437895 - - Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

Hi Benjamin,

Could you please disable Transfer Limit Reached Alert and check if the daily report is still received?

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Sent: 3/6/2025 2:45 PM

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437895 - - Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000McWJz:ref


Hi Botond,

I thought so too but there are no alerts setup yet.
But still one of our admins does get the daily report.

Best regards
Benjamin

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Thursday, 6 March 2025 13:38
To: KASTO IT-Abteilung <IT@kasto.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437895 - - Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

Hi Benjamin,

You can find the alerts that were set up in Alerts -> Device Control Alerts, and there you can edit them and check who was set up to receive the alert in the Administrators box.
It should look something like this:
[Image_2025-03-06_14-35-00.png]

On the bottom of the page you can see who was selected to be monitored:
[Image_2025-03-06_14-37-32.png]

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: KASTO IT-Abteilung [it@kasto.com]
Sent: 3/6/2025 1:22 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437895 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000McWJz:ref - Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000McWJz:ref


Hi Botond,

Thank you. I’ve found the setting. Can you explain where the recipient of the Transfer Limit Report is set ?

Best regards
Benjamin

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Thursday, 6 March 2025 11:14
To: KASTO IT-Abteilung <IT@kasto.com>
Subject: Transfer Limit Event [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0McWJz:ref ]

Hi Benjamin,

Thanks for reaching out!
The transfer limit settings can be configured in Device Control -> Global Settings, or for each computer/user individually:
[Image_2025-03-06_12-12-00.png]

You can check which files were transferred in Reports and Analysis -> File tracing, where you can filter them to only show you the relevant entries:
[Image_2025-03-06_12-13-23.png]

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.[Image removed by sender.]

Hi Benjamin,

You can still create an alert for transfer limit even if you disable it in the Global Settings.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer

The transfer limit settings can be configured in Device Control -> Global Settings, or for each computer/user individually:


You can check which files were transferred in Reports and Analysis -> File tracing, where you can filter them to only show you the relevant entries:

Hi Benjamin,

You can find the alerts that were set up in Alerts -> Device Control Alerts, and there you can edit them and check who was set up to receive the alert in the Administrators box.
It should look something like this:
[Image_2025-03-06_14-35-00.png]

On the bottom of the page you can see who was selected to be monitored:
[Image_2025-03-06_14-37-32.png]
